alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Gilmer; Northwest Webster; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:57AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Gilmer, Braxton and central Webster Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 257 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Cedar Creek State Park to 6 miles northeast of Birch River. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sutton, Webster Springs, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Burnsville, Flatwoods, Diana, Shock, Wilsie, Rosedale, Exchange, Little Birch, Heaters, Bergoo, Cedarville, Centralia, Erbacon and Falls Mills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 56 and 78. Route 19 between mile markers 64 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
